corePandals.name: Sovabazar Rajbari (Boro Taraf)
corePandals.description: One of the most famous heritage pujas, started in 1757 by Raja Nabakrishna Deb. This is the palace of the elder son.

corePandals.description: The puja of the younger son's family, located adjacent to the main palace. Known for its grandeur and traditional Pratima.

corePandals.name: Rani Rashmoni Bari Pujo (Janbazar)

corePandals.name: Thanthania Dutta Bari

corePandals.name: Darjipara Mitra Bari
corePandals.description: Famous for its massive 'ekchala' idol and the tradition of worshipping the same idol structure for the entire year. Started in 1809.

corePandals.name: Jorasanko Daw Bari
corePandals.description: Known for its stunning traditional idol decorations, particularly the use of silver foil and ornaments ('Daaker Saaj').

corePandals.name: Bhawanipore Mallick Bari

corePandals.name: Badan Chandra Roy Bari (Colootola)
corePandals.description: A well-preserved heritage residence with a beautiful quadrangle where the 160-year-old puja is held.
